attributes.action: Grant Tier 1 General Applicants ILR After 5 Years Continuous Legal Stay In UK
attributes.background: Tier 1 general migrants are experiencing great unfairness and inhumane treatment from the Home Office. Many have been criminalized or turned into illegal immigrants by the hostile immigration rules. With the program wrapped up on 6 April 2018, many in this category have been adversely affected.
attributes.additional_details:
Home Office base refusal decisions for leave to remain on unfair premises such as failing genuine income test even when tax has been paid on such income or citing minor tax errors. Most of these decisions cannot be subject to reasonable challenge due to the black letter law of the Point Based System introduced in 2014 that implicitly confers absolute power on decision makers.

Tier 1 migrants took legal route offered by the UK in migrating here, it is morally unfair to deny them their rights.

attributes.action: I want the employees' contracts with zero hours to disappear.
attributes.background:
I want the employees' contracts with zero hours to disappear.
Staff recruitment agencies and companies should be sanctioned if they do not hand over to employees the minimum work contract signed and job description.
attributes.additional_details: I want a normative act that clearly stipulates that work contracts with font size of rights and obligations, terms and conditions of minimum 10 and not written in very small letters, in order not to violate the employee's right to correct, complete and accurate information.

attributes.action: Amend Equality Act 2010 by adding a provision for "Other" characteristics.
attributes.background: Change discrimination legislation, by adding another protected characteristic to the Equality Act 2010, namely "Other": a characteristic not included in the act but including traits/features/qualities, which could potentially attract discriminatory behaviour.
attributes.additional_details:
Currently, the only characteristics on which it is unlawful to discriminate are age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage and civil partnership, race, religion, sex, sexual orientation and pregnancy/maternity. 
However, there is no recourse for people discriminated because of their weight, tattoos or sociocultural affiliation. This petition aims to change this by adding an “Other” option and thus not allowing people to be discriminated because of who they are within the rigid boundaries of the law, to be determined by Judges upon hearing and reading the evidence.

attributes.action: Make 14 June 2018 a national day of mourning.
attributes.background: The appalling Grenfell Tower fire of 14 June 2017 deserves a fitting nationwide commemoration.

attributes.action: Make all types of packaging 100% recyclable or biodegradable
attributes.background: All forms of packaging for every type of product made within, imported to or exported from the UK should be 100% recyclable or biodegradable

attributes.action: Mandatory 10 year custodial sentence for people caught carrying a knife.
attributes.background: Too often we hear of the devastating effects knife crime is having on peoples lives. Families losing loved ones to cowardly attacks by malicious gangs and individuals who use knives to kill or harm others. There does not appear to be enough of a deterrent to stop this behaviour.
attributes.additional_details:
Early in the last century in Glasgow, Razor Gangs were rife, cutting and slashing each other with cut throat razors. In the 1950's this behaviour had started to raise its ugly head yet again. The Judge Lord Carmont at that time saw it fit to issue 10 year sentences to those caught carrying. The impact on this crime was almost instantaneous and the Razor Gangs soon phased out.

It is also well documented that by carrying a knife that person is more likely to be a victim of a stabbing.

attributes.action: Allow paganism to be taught in schools as part of the RE curriculum
attributes.background: Paganism is still being ignored by the curriculum despite being one of the oldest religions in the world and a religion from which many newer religions have borrowed traditions. Paganism is at the heart of British history and should be taught to allow understanding of our heritage to UK children.

attributes.action: stop charging the public 15p to call the non-emergency 101 line
attributes.background: young man knocking on my door at 1.15am. Tried ringing 999. when man walked off rang local police station and was told to ring 101 which I did. After 15 minutes with no reply rang off but was charged 15p. I think it wrong that we are charged for ringing the police

attributes.action: Encourage Banks to form a marketplace in our communities for general services.
attributes.background: Banks need to consider how best to meet the continuing needs of households and businesses alike. There should be a marketplace in our towns where Banks can maintain a presence together which would be beneficial to those customers who prefer or need a face to face service.
attributes.additional_details: The Financial Conduct Authority have already logged my comments on this matter and will consider it in their on going regulation of the banking markets. The infirm/disabled, those lacking confidence on line, those with poor broadband provision or requiring to bank coin; cannot be done at any mobile banking alternative. All of these will be severely impacted upon should the trend of Bank closures continue.

attributes.action: Make the misuse of a disabled parking bay a criminal offence.
attributes.background: It common to find, usually expensive cars using disabled bays without having a right to a Blue Badge.
attributes.additional_details: There are a number of facebook pages dedicated to bad parking which lists hundreds of cars in disabled bays not displaying a blue badge.

attributes.action: Set up a National Register for carers  and Health Care Assistants
attributes.background: Families need to feel safe in the knowledge that carers who carry out work with the utmost trust need to belong on a national register.

attributes.action: Issue guidance to make employers aware of their duties to menopausal workers.
attributes.background: To recognise and address menopause within the workplace and ensure support measures are in place, also to be aware of the impacts that it may have upon an individual and their overall health and wellbeing.
attributes.additional_details:
The impact upon an individual during the menopause can be quite disabling which can affect the biopsychosocial aspects of our lives.

If a female is not supported in the workplace they may lose their confidence, social skills, their finances and their job, the loss to an employer can be huge, this is in terms of how much experience, knowledge and skills an individual may have and are valuable assets to a company, which could be unnecessarily lost due to lack of care and support.

attributes.action: Undertake due diligence on Severn tolling to consider extending beyond end-2018
attributes.background: The abolition of the tolls will have serious economic consequences for the locality as resulting traffic growth impacts an already severely congested motorway network. A tolling extension will assist in the alleviation of congestion at little additional cost and aid WAG with relief road project time
attributes.additional_details: The M4 network in Wales is not equipped for the expected post-tolls traffic growth. Without the tolls ‘buffer’ any perceived financial boost to the economy will be effectively lost in the ensuing traffic chaos. The introduction of an extended tolling sliding scale regime (designed to collect 2018 tolls over 2018-2021) will have long lasting benefits. It will not compromise DfT debt recovery, end-users will not be financially disadvantaged, and it offers WAG a time extension for its relief scheme

attributes.action: Same sex married couples should be able to divorce on grounds of adultery
attributes.background: When the UK Government welcomed same sex marriage and updated the Marriage Act accordingly, they neglected to sufficiently update the divorce law. We are now living in a country where same sex couples cannot divorce under the grounds of adultery. Where is the equality? Equal rights for all.
attributes.additional_details: Adultery is not legally recognised as grounds for marriage dissolution in the UK. The message this sends out is that the laws will selectively discriminate. It also shows a lack of foresight and planning - always check your dependencies (cause and effect of law changes).

attributes.action: Sanction the South African Government, if it fails to act on all farm murders.
attributes.background: Farmers are being slaughtered, the SA government isn't providing adequate measures to prevent it. UK citizens either residing in or having families abroad are concerned about safety and request support in the form of sanctions if they continue not to act.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2017/02/23/british-woman-killed-south-africa-robbers-torture-blow-torch/

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QU93hQjV8GE

attributes.action: Make dog and cat runs planning permission exempt
attributes.background: Dog and cat runs are a grey area in the planning regulations as they are not a fixed structure, removable, and can not be considered a livable so do not come under planning rules but are also a fence and attached to or next to the house which some councils consider requiring planning permission.
attributes.additional_details: In relation to this, a conservatory, which is a livable space, a fixed structure, non removable, and increases the value of the property, does not require planning permission. This petition asks that the rules be amended to allow safe protection for our loved pets by allowing dog and cat runs extending no further that 4/5 meters from the rear wall of the original house the same as conservatories are 3/4 meters depending if the house is attached or detached.

attributes.action: Prevent the DVLA from selling personal information to outside companies
attributes.background: It has come to light that the DVLA are selling personal information to parking companies for the purpose of pursuing individuals in respect of alleged parking offences

attributes.action: Change the legal driving age to 16
attributes.background: At 16, you can get married and have children, drive a motor bike but you can’t drive a car, this is unfair.

attributes.action: Revoke the Amendment to the Double Taxation Agreement (Article 18)  March 2018.
attributes.background:
We were in the Royal Air Force for just under 30 years.  We had met and holidayed in Cyprus towards the latter part of our service.
We decided that we would like to remain in Cyprus after our years were up.
The amended DTA would reduce the amount of household income Veterans' have to live on.
attributes.additional_details:
The proposed amendment to the DTA, signed by both Governments in March 2018 (and yet to be passed by either parliament), proposes that from next year, Civil Service and Military Pensions will be taxed at source (the U.K.) and not as the majority of us arranged, when we decided to live and contribute here in Cyprus.

All we ask is that we can continue to live and contribute here with the same agreements in place from 1960, and even with Cyprus joining the E.U. in 2004.

attributes.action: Animal abuse charges to be the same as human abuse charges
attributes.background: Murder is murder, assault is assault, physical abuse is physical abuse whether it is a human or an animal anyone found murdering or assaulting an animal should be punished the same as if they had murdered/assaulted a human to the maximum extent of the law.
attributes.additional_details:
Thousands of animals are killed murdered, brutally beaten, or left to starve to death. The sentencing for these offences is often a minimum Unlimited fine and/or 6 months. Help to stop animal suffering by signing our petition. 

Examples: - 
http://www.da4a.org/sport.htm
https://www.mirror.co.uk/news/uk-news/katy-gammon-solicitor-who-locked-3391542
https://www.snopes.com/fact-check/donald-trumps-son-game-hunting-photos/

attributes.action: Paramedic students with a first degree to get government student loans.
attributes.background:
NHS funding has stopped this year for Paramedics. It is now a self funded course. Paramedics are an Allied Health Care Profession. 
However unlike other health care professions you cannot get government student finance to cover your course fees, if you have a first degree.
attributes.additional_details:
People affected by this inequality of funding, have been offered university places to study on the grounds that they have the life and education to study and be excellent paramedics. 
However, unlike other allied health care professions paramedic students can not get funding if they have a degree already. If you want to study other health care professions you can get funding. This is very unfair. These students are often making sacrifices and life changes. It is being made almost impossible for us to study as paramedics. We want the same equality as others wanting to study a health care profession. 
We have unsuccessfully asked the University minister, Health and Education ministers to look into this. 
Nothing has changed. 
We have not had a good reason for this inequality.

attributes.action: Introduce mandatory labelling for meat from animals reared with antibiotics.
attributes.background: Increasing bacterial antibiotic resistance is "one of the biggest threats to global health" (WHO). Agricultural use of antibiotics in the UK is decreasing (UK-VARSS), but knowledge of the threat to public health is limited. Labelling would increase knowledge and encourage consumer choice.
attributes.additional_details:
Awareness of the threat of antibiotic resistance is increasing. Public health measures to deal with it have focussed on correct use and prescription of therapeutic antibiotics. However, there is less knowledge of the threat posed by veterinary antibiotics.

A food labelling regime would raise awareness of this issue, and support the ongoing aim of reducing use. It also informs consumers about agricultural practice on imported food, which will be more important after Brexit.

attributes.action: Ban LED vehicle headlights
attributes.background: These new LED headlights are horrendous for drivers with any kind of light sensitivity, and probably not great for anyone. I literally put my hand in front of my eyes when a car with these lights approach. Instinctive reflex to protect my eyes, highly dangerous when driving!  Normal headlights fine.

attributes.action: Stop the proposed changes to funding for refuges and short term housing.
attributes.background: These proposals will remove the only guaranteed funding for refuges from the welfare system. Effectively preventing vulnerable women from paying part of the cost of their accommodation in refuges with housing benefit resulting in mass closures of refuges.
attributes.additional_details: Funding for supported housing paragraph 68 on page 26 of the 58 page document details the proposed changes. Housing benefit currently meets about half of refuge funding resulting in closures of many.These changes withdraw all guaranteed funding for refuges for vulnerable women fleeing abuse putting them at further risk. Closures of refuges would result in enormous increased costs for alternative housing for local authorities.

attributes.action: Ban disposable coffee cups as people are unaware of their impact on environment.
attributes.background: In the UK we use 7 million coffee cups every day. Even though coffee cups are classified as recyclable, only 1 per 400 cups is able to go through the recycling process the rest go into landfill due to the way they are manufactured. To protect our environment the government need to take action.
attributes.additional_details:
The action which could be taken would be for the government to look into Eco-friendly options to replace the coffee cup. 

The government also need to raise awareness to all consumers of disposable hot drinks, that, although they are supposed to be disposable, in reality very few are, because they cannot be recycled.

attributes.action: Ban ALL formulas on public sale that contain microbeads.
attributes.background: The government is banning the use of microbeads in "Rinse off" products. The cosmetic companies complain that to reformulate all their products which contain microbeads would mean changing 90% of their formulas. So government's ban only covers 10% of the use of microbeads.

attributes.action: Expel Venezuelan Diplomats and close their Embassy in London
attributes.background: Venezuela is acting like a rogue state. Its citizens are being denied their basic rights and it’s been linked with narco-trafficking and the sales of passports to the black market. Due to the economic meltdown in Venezuela there is a high risk to UK citizens allowing Venezuelan diplomats in the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
Venezuelan Diplomats should be expelled and the Embassy in London closed to avoid risk to the UK:

https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/venezuela/terrorism 

https://www.bbc.co.uk/iplayer/episode/b090fb4z/hardtalk-isaias-medina-minister-counsellor-of-venezuela-to-the-un-20152017 

http://edition.cnn.com/2017/04/07/americas/venezuela-government-workers-syrian-passport-sales/index.html 

https://www.europarltv.europa.eu/programme/world/sakharov-prize-2017-venezuela-s-opposition-in-a-crisis-struck-country

attributes.action: Make the DVLA Vehicle Records and HPI records available to the public for FREE
attributes.background:
Fight for the freedom of information and the abuse by the current system forcing people to pay £20 to check a car for its records! 
All information should be free to the public including the details of the registered keepers. In many scenarios this free information could avoid a lot of difficulties
attributes.additional_details: It is unbelievable that the publics rights to freedom of information is In 2018 still being violated by the DVLA and car keeper details are still withheld from the public and kept secret only to be sold to third party companies [clamping and parking firms] (for £2.50 each check) it is absurd that these details should be held private and it shouldnt be any different than The Land Register that is available to the public. I don’t think I need to explain why all the HPI records should be free.

attributes.action: Abolition of the coarse fishing closed season on rivers (16th March-16th June)
attributes.background: This outdated law has left us Angler’s twiddling our thumbs for years, there is no evidence to prove all year round fishing harms fish’s breeding habits, no effects have been seen on commercial fisheries and canals which have had no closed season for years.
attributes.additional_details: We have also seen the loss of Tackle & bait shops for years during the closed season as takings reduce massively, fishing seems to be a dying hobby which is a crying shame as kids and adults alike could do with more outside pastimes not less. More fishing time and longer evenings (in closed season) can give the sport and local businesses a real boost and give more opportunities for people to take up Angling.

attributes.action: We want a public enquiry into whether children are needlessly taken into care
attributes.background: More and more children are being removed from families by social services. Applications to take children into care are at record levels. We need a public enquiry to look at why this is happening and whether children are being needlessly removed from their families.

attributes.action: Require shops to make all aisles wide enough for wheelchairs, scooters and prams
attributes.background: Stores are packed with as many goods as possible, regardless of the store size. Unfortunately, this means the aisle space between goods can be very small. For those in wheelchairs, using scooters, or pushing a pram, this proves to be a real problem. This is an example of indirect discrimination.
attributes.additional_details: Small aisle space can be perceived as being off-putting, embarrassing and offensive for those who are unable to move through the space with ease. This not only can have a negative impact on a personal level, but also on the store itself as some may be put off from shopping there again. We do not tend to have this issue with supermarkets due to their traditional layout of wide aisles. This petition hopes to raise awareness, whilst asking for policy to be introduced to tackle the problem.

attributes.action: Send out a booklet to every household in the UK about leaving the EU
attributes.background: The government spent £9 million of taxpayers money informing the public they wanted to remain in the EU and why. The people rejected the governments view and gave an instruction to leave the EU  . The government must now spend an equal amount on a Brexit booklet explaining the advantages of Brexit
attributes.additional_details:
The public are being bombarded with scaremongering from the media and politicians of the damage Brexit will cause to our country.
It is time for the government to provide a booklet promoting the positives of being an independent nation again and set out its vision of the future for our trade, workers and civil rights, security and the revival of our fishing fleets. 

The government must act fairly and provide a Brexit booklet on the advantages of leaving the single market and customs union

attributes.action: Ban Bird Scarers In residential areas. A law instead of NFU code to be made.
attributes.background: Bird scarers are being used more frequently in residential areas by farmers. Their noise level is 165 dB, their frequency during the day is too often and they are disturbing people trying to live a normal life. Everyone has the right to a quiet life. This is antisocial behaviour which needs ending.
attributes.additional_details:
Environmental Healrh do not have enough power to stop this practice due to an outdated NFU code of practice. The laws need changing to include this as a
Noise nuisance. It effects shift workers, pets, sale of houses, mental health and every day life. Birds fly away, humans can’t. Birds get used to it and go to where the sound is as they know there is food. 

They need to be banned completely in residential areas. They cause untold misery for many.

attributes.action: Halt the rollout of fingerprint scanners to police
attributes.background: The Home Office is beginning a trial of new fingerprint scanners with West Yorkshire Police. These scanners connect to an app on a police officer's phone, allowing quick checking of the person's fingerprints against criminal and immigration databases. This has not had any parliamentary scrutiny.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.gov.uk/government/news/police-trial-new-home-office-mobile-fingerprint-technology

https://www.liberty-human-rights.org.uk/news/blog/why-its-not-okay-police-quietly-roll-out-spot-fingerprint-scanning

attributes.action: UK government to recognise East Jerusalem as the capital of Palestine.
attributes.background: In response to the action taken by the US president Donald Trump the UK government should recognise East Jerusalem as the capital of Palestine. This would help with the 2 state peace solution and take away the negativity of the actions taken by the USA.

attributes.action: Make the waiting lists for NHS gender identity clinics shorter
attributes.background: I’m a trans young person with mental health difficulties & I’m currently on a 2 year waiting list for a gender identity clinic. I feel like this waiting time is detrimental to my mental health difficulties & the long waiting time isn’t fair on myself or other trans people experiencing the same thing
attributes.additional_details: Long waiting times for specialist treatment can not only cause someone with gender dysphoria to go downhill, but it can be so frustrating and upsetting for trans people and their families. It takes a lot of courage to come out as trans and the long waiting times make us feel unimportant. Feeling as if you’re in the wrong body and being so desperate to change is really challenging and I feel like we should be able access support sooner.

attributes.action: Make "Jerusalem" England's official national anthem by law
attributes.background: Two years ago, a bill passed the first reading backing the call to consider an official national anthem for the nation of England to be played for major UK and Commonwealth events. This petition builds on that bill, and humbly asks to make 'Jerusalem' the official national anthem of England.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-derbyshire-35296296, "MPs back calls for English national anthem". BBC News. London: BBC. 13 January 2016.

https://services.parliament.uk/bills/2015-16/englishnationalanthem.html, English National Anthem Bill 2015-16.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rT1HEXNI9c4, 'Jerusalem', the song in question.

attributes.action: Erect a statue of Nye Bevan in the Houses of Parliament celebrating the NHS.
attributes.background: The founder of the greatest achievment this country has witnessed should be recognised, by a statue in the houses of parliament.

attributes.action: All schools to offer optional sessions so children can learn about growing food
attributes.background:
In the UK we've a proud heritage in the growing of our food. Be it on farms, allotments or in our gardens. 

Sadly though, many children haven't had the pleasure of harvesting their own veg for their plate. 

We feel that children need access to areas to experience growing food for themselves.

attributes.action: To create correct training for police who investigate rape allegations.
attributes.background:
Too many rape victims have been let down by our justice system. They themselves are made to feel like it was their fault, or they were in the wrong. 
This is not right. Do victims of theft find themselves being treated the same way?
attributes.additional_details:
70% Of women will not report a rape. 
Conviction rates for rape are far lower than other crimes, with only 5.7% of reported rape cases ending in a conviction for the perpetrator.
Correct training needs to be provided for police officers who investigate rape allegations, so these victims can be treated with respect, listened to and helped.

attributes.action: Issue British passports without the EU logo.
attributes.background: As the British people voted to leave the EU on 23 June 2016 and will be entirely out by March 2019, stop issuing British passports with the EU logo immediately and give people the option to exchange a passport with an EU logo for one without an EU logo, for a small fee.

attributes.action: Reverse the government plans to remove women's refuges from the welfare system.
attributes.background: Katie Ghose, the chief executive of Women’s Aid, said: “The government’s proposed reforms to supported housing will dismantle our national network of lifesaving refuges and put the lives of women and children trying to escape domestic abuse at risk. This is a matter of life or death.”
attributes.additional_details:
Katie Ghose, the chief executive of Women’s Aid told the Guardian

 “If pursued, the reforms will result in a postcode lottery of domestic abuse support services, with ... refuges being forced to close their doors and more women and children being turned away from the lifesaving support they offer,” she said.

The reforms fly in the face of pledges made by the prime minister to make it a key personal priority to transform the way the UK tackles domestic violence.

attributes.action: Consider extenuating circumstances when determining maximum uni maintenance loan
attributes.background: University maintenance costs are expensive. Whilst loans are allocated according to household income, this policy assumes that parents are willing to help out their child with payments - something not all parents are willing to do, preventing students from doing well in or even attending university.
attributes.additional_details: I want the government to allow for students in such situations to appeal for a greater maintenance loan. It is considered unfair that students wanting to carry on their education should be held back due to their financial backgrounds, and I would argue that this too is affected by the willingness of parents to support their children. Everyone wanting to go to university should be given the opportunity to do so, and this includes maximising support for students who will struggle with living costs!

attributes.action: Require winter tyres on all vehicles from 1st November to 31st March each year
attributes.background: Reduce risk of accidents on roads in winter conditions. Motorists stuck on the motorways in winter like on the M74 16th-17th Jan 2018 less likely. Uncleared roads generally still passable. Makes the roads safer for those who use winter tyres already.

attributes.action: Create a new minimum wage called the Qualified minimum wage.
attributes.background: When a person is trained or qualified to do a job, they should automatically qualify for the qualified minimum wage (in line with the age group)  which is a higher rate to recognise the skill.
attributes.additional_details:
I understand that at the moment there is no national recognised wage for a qualified person. Therefore there is no incentive to invest in training or learning a trade. 
Weather you are a nurse, plumber, driver, dental nurse or brick layer. Skills should be recognised.

attributes.action: Amend Representation of the Peoples act 1983 to include Social Media campaigns.
attributes.background: Where transparency and fairness within elections is said to be valued within western democracies and is enshrined in British law, social media is being used to undermine these principles and laws, meaning the current law is therefore clearly outdated and unfit for purpose.
attributes.additional_details: S.110 of the Representation of the Peoples act 1983 states that "an imprint must be added to printed election material. The electoral commission's advice on social media surrounding imprint offences however is as follows; "With the increased use of social hi-tech media there are an increasing number of allegations being made in relation to electronic material; however there is no imprint requirement here. The Electoral Commission recommends that the imprint should be provided as good practice.”

attributes.action: Investigate the destruction of Windrush records by the Home Office.
attributes.background:
The Home office said that these documents were disposed of under the Data Protection Act. The result has been thousands of people effectively being made stateless and some being deported. 
There are reports of what happened and of staff raising concerns at the time and being overruled.
attributes.additional_details:
The Windrush generation like millions of immigrants from around the world brought their families here, settled and made a massive contribution to British life. 
 
This government appears to have set out to strip them of their rights by changing the law without debate and disposing of the records. 
 
Shredding historical records that effectively remove rights from British citizens is an appalling abuse of power. 
 
It must be investigated!

attributes.action: Legislation ensuring airlines must seat vulnerable people with their guardians
attributes.background: When booking a flight it should be guaranteed within the price that vulnerable people and young children are seated with their parent/guardian/carer and not exposed to risk of harm by separation on the plane. Protection of children is a right & not a privilege that can be purchased as an "add on"
attributes.additional_details: Airlines are exploiting a human right for vulnerable people to be protected by charging additional for seat allocation on a first come first served basis  and are avoiding responsibility for the safety of ALL passengers. Inevitably a vulnerable person will be abused, assaulted , bullied on an airline and the question asked will be "why were families or vulnerable separated". With modern booking systems there is no reason why seat allocation can't be made within the price in the first instance

attributes.action: Stop Myxomatosis killing wild Rabbits by developing a lifetime vaccine
attributes.background: Myxomatosis is cruel disease which millions of wild rabbits in the UK die from each year. It is not acceptable that such a disease is left unchecked due to it being released illegally in the UK in the 1950’s. Myxomatosis is pure torture for any wild rabbit infected.
attributes.additional_details: They suffer severe conjunctivitis that results in blindness, swelling in the head, ears, eyes and genitals, thick pus discharge from the nose (which makes it difficult to breathe), and lumps on the body for up to two weeks before they die; longer in many cases. Rabbits are sentient beings, who feel pain and suffer every bit as any other animal. I want the Government to actively discuss all the options open to it to combat/control this disease in the wild rabbit population.

attributes.action: Not introduce photo Identification to vote.
attributes.background: Bromley is taking part in a Voter ID "PILOT" at the Local Council Elections on 3 May 2018. This means that Bromley voters must produce ID to vote at a polling station. They will be asked to show one form of photographic ID from a list which includes a passport, photo driving license. BBC
attributes.additional_details: My grown-up children do not directly pay bills. Only 2 drive, my partner and I do not, and this is the case for many people. I don’t see why anyone should have to apply for a passport as it will soon be a less useful document and/or may not be going abroad. Many will not be able to afford one putting a price on the right to vote. Nor should they be left waiting for one to enable them to exercise their democratic right
